questions.question: I stopped ___ to her after the argument.
questions.explanation: 'Stop doing something' means to quit the action.

questions.question: She stopped ___ a coffee on her way to work.
questions.explanation: 'Stop to do something' means you stop another action in order to do this.

questions.question: Remember ___ the lights before you leave.
questions.explanation: 'Remember to do' is used when you don’t forget to do something.

questions.question: I remember ___ to the beach as a child.
questions.explanation: 'Remember doing' is for memories of past actions.

questions.question: He forgot ___ the door.
questions.explanation: 'Forget to do' means you didn’t do the action.

questions.question: I'll never forget ___ her for the first time.
questions.explanation: 'Forget doing' is about a past memory you will always remember.

questions.question: Try ___ more vegetables in your diet.
questions.explanation: 'Try doing' means to experiment with something to see if it helps.

questions.question: Try ___ this medicine; it may help.
questions.explanation: 'Try to do' means to attempt something.

questions.question: He went on ___ about his achievements.
questions.explanation: 'Go on doing' means to continue the same activity.

questions.question: After introducing the topic, she went on ___ about the details.
questions.explanation: 'Go on to do' means to continue with a different activity.

questions.question: She regretted ___ him the truth.
questions.explanation: 'Regret doing' is for actions done in the past that one feels sorry about.

questions.question: I regret ___ you that your application was unsuccessful.
questions.explanation: 'Regret to do' is used when giving bad news.

questions.question: He needs ___ the documents by tomorrow.
questions.explanation: 'Need to do' is active voice and refers to something he must do.

questions.question: She means ___ her best in the competition.
